item.title: 法国新总理承诺进行重大改革，与反对党合作
item.description: 塞巴斯蒂安-勒科努就任法国总理后，承诺要进行重大改革，在削减预算遭到强烈反对的情况下，他试图让反对党参与到控制国家债务的艰巨任务中来。【原文：Sebastien Lecornu took over as France’s prime minister pledging big changes as he tries to engage opposition parties in the herculean task of reining in the country’s debt amid intense opposition to budget cuts.】

item.title: 挪威 2 万亿美元基金寻求扩大可再生能源投资
item.description: 挪威2万亿美元主权财富基金的全球能源和基础设施主管表示，该基金正寻求扩大可再生能源投资，包括对电网等资产的投资。【原文：Norway’s $2 trillion sovereign wealth fund is looking to expand its renewables investments, including into assets such as power grids, according to its global head of energy and infrastructure.】

item.title: 华尔街无视土耳其数据乐观预期，认为降息步伐放缓
item.description: 全球银行对土耳其央行对通胀风险的乐观前景持怀疑态度，预计周四的降息步伐将有所放缓。【原文：Global banks are skeptical of the Turkish central bank’s sanguine outlook on risks to inflation, expecting a down-shift in the pace of interest-rate cuts on Thursday.】

item.title: 当客户拨打 Klarna 的热线时，人工智能首席执行官会接听电话
item.description: 欢迎收看《深度科技》（Tech In Depth），这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日通讯。今天，艾莎-加尼（Aisha Gani）与 Klarna 首席执行官的人工智能化身进行了对话。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Aisha Gani speaks with the AI alter ego of Klarna’s CEO.】

item.title: 糟糕的经济数据让人对美国及其机构产生怀疑
item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂（Chris Anstey），波士顿的一名经济学编辑，今天我们将探讨美国就业的修正史。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston, and today we’re looking at a revisionist history of US employment. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 特朗普关税授权进入最高法院快速通道
item.description: 美国最高法院计划于 11 月初就一宗案件进行辩论，以决定唐纳德-特朗普总统第二任期的大部分关税是否合法。【原文：The US Supreme Court is planning arguments for early November in a case to decide whether the bulk of President Donald Trump’s second-term tariffs are legal.】

item.title: 即使遭遇 32 亿美元挤压，空头仍重返 AppLovin
item.description: 做空者再次把目光投向了 AppLovin 公司，尽管在过去六个月里，押注该软件生产商股票的交易商已经蒙受了约 32 亿美元的纸面损失。【原文：Short-sellers are once again setting their sights on AppLovin Corp., even after traders who bet against the software maker’s shares got burned with an estimated $3.2 billion in paper losses over the past six months.】

item.title: 美国房贷利率创 11 个月新低 重启住房融资活动
item.description: 美国抵押贷款利率上周降至近一年来的最低点，引发了再融资活动的激增，并鼓励潜在购房者放弃观望。【原文：US mortgage rates declined last week to an almost one-year low, sparking a surge in refinancing activity and encouraging prospective buyers to step off the sidelines.】

item.title: Spotify 为付费用户推出高保真功能
item.description: Spotify Technology SA 正在为付费用户推出更高品质的音效，这是这家流媒体公司为提升其最佳用户的听觉体验而做出的最新努力。【原文：Spotify Technology SA is introducing higher-quality sound for paying subscribers, the streaming company’s latest effort to enhance the listening experience for its best customers.】

item.title: 凯雷警告：降息在即，财政部和美联储角色模糊不清
item.description: 据凯雷集团（Carlyle Group Inc.【原文：The Trump administration’s call for steep Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts, coupled with the prospect of higher short-term US debt issuance, risks disrupting the Treasury market and could end up driving longer-term borrowing costs higher, according to the Carlyle Group Inc.】

item.title: 威兹航空关闭维也纳基地以降低成本实现扭亏为盈
item.description: 威兹航空控股公司（Wizz Air Holdings Plc）计划结束在维也纳的运营，因为这家折扣航空公司面临着持续的成本压力，正在缩减其增长雄心。【原文：Wizz Air Holdings Plc plans to end operations in Vienna as the discount carrier, facing persistent cost pressure, scales back its growth ambitions.】

item.title: 在线旅行社 Loveholidays 着眼于首次公开募股，推动英国市场发展
item.description: 在线旅行社 Loveholidays 正准备上市，以利用英国对套餐式假期需求的增长，这可能是伦敦奄奄一息的首次公开募股市场的一剂强心针。【原文：Online travel agent Loveholidays is preparing to go public to take advantage of increased UK demand for packaged holidays, in what could be a pick-me-up for London’s moribund market for initial public offerings.】

item.title: 电子商务经销商 Pattern、支持者在首次公开募股中寻求 3.214 亿美元资金
item.description: Pattern Group Inc.是一家在亚马逊（Amazon.com Inc.）等市场上转售商品的电子商务公司，该公司及其部分投资者正寻求在首次公开募股中筹集高达 3.214 亿美元的资金。【原文：Pattern Group Inc., an e-commerce firm that resells goods on marketplaces such as Amazon.com Inc., and some of its investors are seeking to raise as much as $321.4 million in an initial public offering.】

item.title: 新成立的 Ardian 基础设施基金将突破 100 亿欧元的目标
item.description: 熟悉情况的人士称，随着投资者在基础设施领域寻找机会，Ardian 公司最新基金的筹资额有望超过 100 亿欧元（117 亿美元）的目标。【原文：Ardian is on track to exceed the €10 billion ($11.7 billion) fundraising target for its latest fund, people familiar with the effort said, as investors look for opportunities in the infrastructure segment.】

item.title: 无论利率如何变化，信贷市场数学都会让买家套现
item.description: 全球企业债券市场的投资者发现，无论周围发生什么，他们都能赚钱。【原文：Investors in the global corporate bond market find themselves in a situation where they make money whatever happens around them.】

item.title: 交易商权衡供应和中国经济，铜价保持稳定
item.description: 伦敦金属交易所铜价持稳于每吨 9,900 美元上方，交易商正在权衡印度尼西亚的供应风险以及中国工业经济通缩压力正在缓解的迹象。【原文：Copper held steady above $9,900 a ton on the London Metal Exchange, with traders weighing supply risks in Indonesia and signs that deflationary pressures are easing in China’s industrial economy.】

item.title: 捷豹路虎称部分数据在网络攻击中受损
item.description: 捷豹路虎表示，英国汽车制造商受到网络攻击后，部分数据遭到泄露，生产和销售受到影响。【原文：Jaguar Land Rover said some data has been compromised after the British carmaker was hit by a cyberattack that’s derailed production and sales.】

item.title: 加纳国内生产总值以近一年来最快速度增长，超出预期
item.description: 加纳第二季度经济增长速度为近一年来最快，超过了经济学家的预期。【原文：Ghana’s economy expanded at its fastest pace in almost a year in the second quarter, beating economists’ estimates.】

item.title: 加密货币财政狂潮已然熄火
item.description:
投资者正在质疑因持有加密货币而购买股票的整个前提。【原文：

Investors are questioning the whole premise of buying a stock for its crypto holdings.

】

item.title: 业绩不佳的对冲基金交易员是最热门的招聘对象
item.description:
由于人才供不应求，顶级公司将竞争对手的亏损投资组合经理视为难得的招聘机会。【原文：

With talent in short supply, top firms are looking at rival loss-making portfolio managers as a rare hiring opportunity.

】

item.title: 八月印度股票基金流入量因基金发行量减少而下降
item.description: 印度共同基金协会（Association of Mutual Funds in India）的数据显示，8月份股票基金的净流入额从前一个月创纪录的4,270亿卢比放缓至3,343亿卢比（38亿美元）。【原文：Net inflows into stock funds in August slowed to 334.3 billion rupees ($3.8 billion) from a record 427 billion rupees in the previous month, data from the Association of Mutual Funds in India show.】

item.title: 西门子医疗集团被指正就诊断产品出售事宜进行早期谈判
item.description: 知情人士透露，西门子医疗集团（Siemens Healthineers AG）一直在与一些最大的私募股权公司就可能出售其诊断业务部门进行探索性讨论，因为这家德国公司正寻求精简其业务。【原文：Siemens Healthineers AG has been holding exploratory discussions with some of the largest private equity firms about a potential sale of its diagnostics segment, people with knowledge of the matter said, as the German company seeks to streamline its operations.】

item.title: 怀登称微软漏洞导致美国医院系统遭黑客攻击
item.description: 参议员罗恩-怀登（Ron Wyden），来自俄勒冈州的民主党人，参议院财政委员会排名第一的成员，7 月在华盛顿举行的确认听证会上。【原文：Senator Ron Wyden, a Democrat from Oregon and ranking member of the Senate Finance Committee, during a confirmation hearing in Washington in July.】

item.title: 阿根廷出现 "反米莱派"，加剧投资者恐慌情绪
item.description: 本周末，哈维尔-米莱伊总统的政党在选举中遭到了一边倒的惨败，而在这些头条新闻的掩盖下，还有一个可能更令阿根廷投资者感到不安的消息：阿克塞尔-基西洛夫（Axel Kicillof）重新崛起。【原文：Buried underneath the headlines trumpeting the lopsided electoral defeat suffered by President Javier Milei’s party this weekend was a development potentially even more troubling for investors in Argentina: the re-emergence of Axel Kicillof.】

item.title: 怀登称微软漏洞导致美国医院系统遭黑客攻击
item.description: 美国参议员罗恩-怀登（Ron Wyden）说，微软公司存在明显的网络安全漏洞，导致美国一家医院系统遭到勒索软件攻击，他呼吁联邦贸易委员会进行调查。【原文：US Senator Ron Wyden says glaring cybersecurity flaws by Microsoft Corp. enabled a ransomware attack on a US hospital system and has called on the Federal Trade Commission to investigate.】

item.title: 亚洲科技股涨势超过地缘政治，新兴股市反弹
item.description: 新兴市场股市创下自 6 月份以来的最大四天涨幅，原因是亚洲科技公司的反弹超过了欧洲和中东日益增长的地缘政治风险。【原文：Emerging-market stocks headed for the largest four-day advance since June, as a rally in Asian tech companies outweighed growing geopolitical risks in Europe and the Middle East.】

item.title: 中国太平寻求从可转换债券销售中获得高达 20 亿美元的资金
item.description: 根据彭博新闻社看到的交易条款，中国太平洋保险（集团）股份有限公司正寻求通过出售 2030 年 9 月到期的可转换为股票的债券筹集高达 156 亿港元（20 亿美元）的资金。【原文：China Pacific Insurance (Group) Co. is seeking to raise as much as HK$15.6 billion ($2 billion) from the sale of bonds convertible into stock due September 2030, according to terms of the deal seen by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 就业成为焦点，股票交易员不再担心通胀
item.description: 华尔街的交易员们预计，周四公布的消费者物价指数将引发通胀热潮，但他们并不准备在就业主导市场的情况下对股市做出重大反应。【原文：Wall Street trading desks expect a hot inflation print when the consumer price index hits Thursday, but they aren’t preparing for a big reaction from stocks with jobs dominating the market narrative.】

item.title: NIO 寻求融资超过 10 亿美元以资助电动汽车发展计划
item.description: 电动汽车制造商 NIO 公司计划通过出售股票筹集约 10 亿美元，为其发展提供资金。【原文：Electric vehicle-maker NIO Inc. plans to raise about $1 billion through a share sale to fund its growth.】

item.title: 创纪录涨势后，华尔街专业人士竞相上调 S&P 500 指数目标值
item.description: 随着强劲的企业盈利和对人工智能的重新热情推动了创纪录的涨势，华尔街的预测者们纷纷上调了对 S&P 500 指数的展望。【原文：Wall Street forecasters are rushing to boost their outlook for the S&P 500 as robust corporate earnings and renewed enthusiasm around artificial intelligence fuel a record-breaking rally.】
